revised_title: Astronomy in Ancient and Medieval China: The Polar and Equatorial Approach
tldr: The article discusses the unique aspects of ancient Chinese astronomy, which was primarily polar and equatorial rather than planetary and ecliptic. It highlights the importance of the celestial pole and the use of the gnomon in Chinese astronomical observations. The article also explores the system of lunar mansions and celestial coordinates in ancient China, as well as the influence of Babylonian and Indian astronomy on the development of these systems.
